results.title: Attenuation of hypertension, cardiomyocyte hypertrophy, and myocardial fibrosis by beta-adrenoceptor blockers in rats under long-term blockade of nitric oxide synthesis.
results.text_hl: Our study demonstrates that @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ reduce @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@arterial hypertension@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D006984 @@@cardiomyocyte hypertrophy@@@ and @DISEASE_Fibrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@myocardial fibrosis@@@ induced by @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@L-NAME@@@, suggesting that beta-blockers are of beneficial value in treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006322 @@@vascular and cardiac alterations@@@ caused by chronic @CHEMICAL_Nitric_Oxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009569 @@@nitric oxide@@@ deficiency.

citations.NLM: Pacca SR, de Azevedo AP, De Oliveira CF, De Luca IM, De Nucci G, Antunes E. Attenuation of hypertension, cardiomyocyte hypertrophy, and myocardial fibrosis by beta-adrenoceptor blockers in rats under long-term blockade of nitric oxide synthesis. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2002 Feb;39(2):201-7. PMID: 11791005
